FuncDef:
The ptp clock-source delay command sets the delay corrections for time signals that a BITS interface sends and receives.
The undo ptp clock-source delay command restores the default delay corrections for time signals that a BITS interface sends and receives.
The default delay correction is 0 ns.
CLIs: ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } { receive-delay <receive-delay-value> | send-delay <send-delay-value> }
ptp clock-source bits1 { receive-delay <receive-delay-value> | send-delay <send-delay-value> } [ slot <slotid> ]
ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] bits1 { receive-delay <receive-delay-value> | send-delay <send-delay-value> } [ slot <slotid> ]
undo ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] { bits0 | bits1 | bits2 } { receive-delay | send-delay }
undo ptp clock-source bits1 { receive-delay | send-delay } [ slot <slotid> ]
undo ptp clock-source [ chassis <chassis-id> ] bits1 { receive-delay | send-delay } [ slot <slotid> ]

ParaDef.Info:
Specifies a chassis, which is represented in the form of chassis type+chassis ID.
The value is a string of 1 to 20 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

Sets the delay correction for time signals that a BITS interface receives.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 2000000, in ns. The default value is 0.

Sets the delay correction for time signals that a BITS interface sends.
The value is an integer that ranges from 0 to 10000, in ns. The default value is 0.

Specifies the slot ID of the main control board. Only the master and slave main control boards that can exchange BITS signals support the parameter.
The value is a string of 1 to 16 case-sensitive characters, spaces not supported.

ExtraInfo:
Usage Scenario
The ptp clock-source receive-delay send-delay command helps a BITS interface correct time signals that the BITS interface exchanges with a clock source or a slave clock based on the specified link delay time.
